definition: sth written or painted in one's own hand/(of a writer, calligrapher or painter) skill/style/hand/(fig.) style shown in spending money, handling business etc/scale
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: The more indulgent the gift the greater the suspicion it seems.
sentences.chinese: 越是阔绰大手笔的礼物越是使人产生更大的怀疑。

sentences.english: The letter is in his own handwriting.
These pictures are from the same painter's brush.
sentences.chinese: 这些画出自同一个画家的手笔。

sentences.english: The act can be at this time can be a masterwork after years study.
sentences.chinese: 在多年的研究之后，此时的性生活能够是大师的手笔。

sentences.english: It is said to go back to the painter Ku K'ai-chi, who lived in the fourth century AD.
sentences.chinese: 据说原本出自公元4世纪的画家顾恺之的手笔。

sentences.english: Our company is mainly engaged in a second-hand pen an origin computer, the figures product trades.
sentences.chinese: 本公司主要从事二手笔本电脑，数码产品贸易。

sentences.english: I recognized the handwriting as that of my father's.
sentences.chinese: 我认出了那是我父亲的手笔。

sentences.english: This inscription was written by Yan Zhenqing, the great calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这个碑铭出自唐代大书法家颜真卿的手笔。

sentences.english: I recognized the handwriting as that of my father.
sentences.chinese: 我认出了这是我父亲的手笔。

sentences.english: The comfortable housing project is fully carried out in Dalian.
sentences.chinese: 大连康居工程出大手笔。

sentences.english: this writer uses vivid descriptions in his writings.
sentences.chinese: 这位作家在他的作品中运用了活泼的手笔。

definition: to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
it goes to show that/one can see
